alert.note: Alert for Alger; Baraga; Dickinson; Gogebic; Houghton; Iron; Keweenaw; Marquette; Ontonagon; Southern Houghton (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 29 at 3:43PM EDT by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...Wintry Weather and heavy precipitation into early next week... A slow moving early spring storm system will bring multiple rounds of precipitation to Upper Michigan through Monday night. A mixture of rain and snow over far western Upper Michigan will change to all snow this evening. Several inches of wet, dense snow accumulation will occur across Gogebic and Ontonagon Counties with lesser accumulations of snow extending across southern Houghton and Iron counties. Slushy snow accumulations on roads could make travel difficult later tonight into Sunday morning. From Sunday night, continuing into Monday night, a surge of widespread, heavier precipitation will arrive along with slightly colder air. As a result, rain will change to moderate to heavy snow across all of western into north central Upper Michigan. Significant accumulations of wet, dense snow will occur, especially over higher terrain. Slushy snow accumulations on roads will make travel difficult. In addition, the loading of wet, dense snow on trees combined with increasing north to northwest winds gusting to 30 to 35 mph could result in tree damage and power outages on Monday. Snow will diminish Monday night and then end during Tuesday. Total liquid precipitation amounts from tonight through Tuesday morning will be between 2 and 4 inches west of a Marquette to Iron Mountain line with locally higher amounts up to 5 inches over the highest terrain of western Upper Michigan. Lesser amounts of 1 to 2 inches will fall over the eastern U.P. This will result in increased runoff and increased stream and river flows through much of next week. Continue to monitor forecasts over the next few days as travel and other impacts are likely.
